1.title: Starting Point.

11.title: Kanto

111.content:
From the very first moment since you were born, throughout the entirety of your childhood and teenage years, you were constantly reminded at almost every opportunity whenever you felt a little too comfortable, a little too complacent, that this was not your world. Now, that’s not you had a bad time growing up it was quite the contrary. You were raised by two very loving parents, lived in a house that always had food, went to a good school in a good neighborhood and even managed to make some friends along the way. The problem was, however, that you were a human. And whenever you felt yourself having too much fun with your after-school pals, or forgot what was decided for you long before you were even conceived, you could simply look up into the sky and remember how utterly small you were.

You lived in a world where the most dominant lifeform was Pokemon, utterly gigantic Pokemon capable of crushing mountains into pancakes under their paws should they choose to ever grow so big. Many don’t, but some of them do, and one of those some, a Dragonite, came past your village one day when you were around twelve. Before that day, you had it in your mind that you would go outside your little home, eventually. It was nice enough, but it was very staid, and in your childlike curiosity you didn't see anything wrong about wanting to see more. And then the Dragonite came. You didn't know how tall he was. Ten thousand feet? Twenty thousand? Whatever measurement of height he was, if he could be measured, all you knew was that the clouds above didn't even reach his chest.

You almost died that day, you and everyone else in the village. You felt the earthquakes half an hour before he even arrived, you would later find out he was taking a nice, relaxing stroll. He was monumentally ripped with muscle, from his neck to his calves, wearing nothing but a pair of workout shorts that covered his private areas. His paw came down just next to your hometown, flattening the forest you always dreamed about playing in, burying rivers and creeks under untold tons of mud and earth, and turned the nearby plateau into mere flatland. Out of the corner of his eye, he spotted the little village by his feet. He apologized and swore quietly under his breath for his clumsiness, but other than that you don’t think he was so beat up about.

You used to dream about leaving your little village. You still do, but they're more akin to nightmares than anything else. Of course, in a funny-really not so funny twist of irony, it was at this stage of life when you were forced to do exactly what you feared the mos. Leave. Pokemon could legally adopt humans as pets, as servants, or as toys if they please, and one Pokemon from the nearby city was in the 'market for one', so to speak. The Pokemon wasn't as big as that Dragonite so long ago, you were told, but still big enough to turn your childhood home into splinters with ease. You, along with all the other humans that met the Pokemon's stringent requirements, were escorted as calmly as possible to the town square, where he would make his selection. You could see his hulking form from miles away, he was a...

1111.content:
Upon seeing the black and orange skin tight attire you knew right away who this giant anthro Pikachu was. It was none other then the famous anthro Pokemon wrestler Zapp, who stood 50 feet tall, but was still heavily muscled and never gave up in a fight no matter what. Though you certainly wasn't expecting him to be the type to want a human as a pet. Especially since you had heard that his father who was a anthro Raichu was trying to get rid of that kind of thing completely. Which now that you think back on it he had for most of the Kanto area, with only a few small cities or towns still not wanting ot give that kind of thing up. But you do remember hearing on the news that both human mayors and anthro ones were in meetings to get rid of either anthros or humans to be pets.

However, these thoughts were quickly pushed to the side when you saw the giant anthro Pikachu was only a few fet away from you. Once this happened you looked up at him and saw that he had a big and warm smile on his face as he said, 'Hey there, little guy. I hope you're ready to have a great ime with me."

"Uh y-yes, of ocurse Mr Zapp. My name's Ryan by the way..." You let out, as you did your best to remain calm.

After you had said this though you saw the smile leave Zapp's face for a moment as he laid his hand down for you to get onto. And while you did he told you, "Hey little guy, no need to be nervous. And there's certainly no need to be formal with me at all. Just call me Zapp. And also for the record Ryan, you'll be living with me as a friend and from what I'm assuming a fan too. You will not be treating like a pet or whatever at all."

"Oh, alright. And yes, I am a fan of yours since I've seen your matches and you're amazing." You explained, as you felt the giant Piakchu carefully get up onto his feet after he made sure your things where in the same hand you were in as well.

And after he did this you saw him continue to look down at you with a big smile on his face again when he told you, "Alright Ryan, so I think the best way for us to start our new lives together is by having you....

1112.content:
The Raichu, a rodent looking Pokemon covered in dark orange fur with a creamy white belly, had to be around a hundred feet tall at the least, you gauged. You had to admit, in spite of the fear you generally had for Pokemon, the Raichu was pretty darn attractive. He had bifurcated ears that ended in wispy curls, a triangular, dark brown nose that twitched occasionally, and two circular electric sacks on his cheek that shot out soft, almost beautiful arcs of lightning from time to time. He had this great big smile plastered onto his visage and was carrying a laid-back happy aura, which managed to slightly calm your flustered state. If those were his only distinctive characteristics, you would only sum him up as being cute. But as you near the square in the middle of your hometown, you got a better look at his body, and his cuteness was drowned out by all the raw masculinity he exuded.

For starters, the Raichu was only dressed in a green, latex speedo that left absolutely nothing to the imagination as to what was underneath and left the rest of his body on full view for everyone to see. A thick neck between large traps, massive round shoulders that could ram walls even without the massive size difference he had over you, thick arms with biceps that bulged constantly with every small motion, topped off with gigantic pectorals that could put every woman you knew to shame. You tried to keep your focus on these features, but naturally, your eyes kept moving back to below his waist, to his speedo. That bouncing bulge, even at its most placid state, jutted out from the rest of his body by a substantial amount, you couldn't even begin to imagine how to describe how utterly big it was.

You were near the edge of the square when the police who were escorting you suddenly and quietly departed. You looked around, and to your confusion, you were the only other human in the square. They told you that there would be others, that you had a chance of not getting selected. Was that...just a lie? It made sense when you thought about it, you wouldn't have been as cooperative if you had known that. Before you could contemplate your escape back to your normal life, the giant Raichu finally took notice of your presence.

“Hey there, little guy!” The monumental rodent’s smile grew even further as his eyes lied on your relatively small frame. Suddenly, you found yourself unable to move or breath. You were just too strict with shock to do anything. The massive Pokemon and noticed your dumbfounded expression and simply giggled a tad smugly. "What, am I too much Pokemon for you to handle?" He gave you a wink before he decided to sit down on the ground to get a better look at you. His massive junk crashed heavily onto the ground, accidentally leaving a decent-sized crater in the flagstone beneath.

“U-Uh...no, sir, not at all!” You quickly stammer out a reply as to not earn the ire of this monumental rodent. You couldn't help but notice his beaming smile wavered for just a split second when you addressed him as ‘sir’. “In f-fact, you’re, like...tiny. In comparison to other Pokemon, I mean. Did you see that pawprint outside of town?” The Raichu’s eyes flashed conflicting emotions of both pride and guilt. This first meeting wasn't going as smoothly as you wanted it to.

“So...you want me to get bigger, is that it? Interesting, I’ll remember that~” He gave your minuscule form a wink that forced warm red blood up to your face in embarrassment. Arceus, this guy was cute. His tone took on a more serious mood as his smile dropped again. “And...my name’s Photon, so you don’t have to call me ‘sir’ or ‘master’ or anything like that, okay?"

"Al...alright, Photon..." You slowly answered, not expecting this kind of treatment from your new master. You came into the town square thinking that this Raichu would treat you nothing more than a cute looking toy, or a novel collectible, you were completely taken aback by how...well, nice he was. "My name's Scott."

"It's nice to meet you, Scott!" Photon reached down his massive paw towards you in what you thought was a handshake at first, but it soon came apparent he wanted you to climb up onto his palm. Hesitantly, you take one last look at the town you knew, convinced it would be the last time you would set your two feet on its ground, and clambered up Photon's fuzzy paw. Very slowly, he raised his hand back up while he stepped away from his kneeling position until you were around a hundred feet in the air next to his grinning mug. "I, uh...know you didn't have so much choice in the matter, but I hope the two of us can be great friends." You couldn't help but smile, maybe this wouldn't be so bad after all. You still carried a bit of anxiety, you probably should have told him you had a fear of heights, but besides that, you felt generally safe in his paw.

"So...where are we going now, si-...Photon?" You cringed internally as you almost said 'sir', your new master walking away from the town square and easily walking over the walls that surrounded your village. He tilts his head to the side before responding, as if mulling it over...

And thankfully you were lucky fan, after you found the winning code that was inside the cap for a soda drink that you enjoyed to drink.

And that was about a three days ago as you broke out of your thoughts when you heard the door to the anthro Pokemon's locker room being opened. And once this happened you saw Blaze in all of his 150 foot heavily muscled glory while his muscles sweat form his latest fight and he still had his fighting clothes on. Though this made you recall a rumor you had heard about him starting ot train a anthro Pikachu named Zapp. Though when asked about it the heavily muscled fire dog would jsut laugh off the question or not give a comment about it.

Although this thought was taken out of your mind when you saw the canine's eyes fall onto you as a big smile spread across his face as he walked towards you and said, "So you're the winner of that contest eh?" You then saw one o fhis fingers move down to you before it was in front of you. He then added, "I honestly wasn't expecting a human winner. But I know hat I have fans of many sizes whether they're anthro or human. So it's nice to meet you, kid. As you know the name's Blaze. So what's yours?"

You found yourself blushing as you took a hold of the hand and shook it with boht of your own while you rpelied, "It's nice to meet you too, Blaze. My name's Sam."

"Well Sam, I hope you're ready for a month of fun while hanging out with the champ!" Blaze told you, folowed by giving a wink which only made you blush a bit more. Though your blush went away upon seeing the anthro dog stand up again before he continued with, "So just let me get cleaned up from my match. And once I'm done with that I think you and I should start our month together by going to...."

You yawned as you walked down the stairs from your beach home to the sandy grass below. After highschool you wanted to get a nice place to start the new chapter of your life, luckily Kanto had a good number of houses by the coast for a reasonable price. You always loved the ocean and water Pokemon so it was a perfect home.

Right now you were going to chill at the beach, enjoy the morning winds carry the lovely seaside air. You got a job not only providing good pay but also putting your interest to use. Your job was writing articles on the latest Pokemon anthro athletes in the news. This was great as not only did you get to write your passion but you also got to meet the giants, interviewing them for your articles.

Later you would be preparing a new article, this one about a anthro named Aqua. He was a Vaporeon and champion swimmer who's held the title 3 years now. You felt your face heat up as you remembered his photoshoot in the magazine. Despite being a swift swimmer Aqua had a large and buff body, with huge pecs and a eight pack ab set along with his jacked arms.

"Maybe i could get an interview, take some below shots.", you patted your cheeks as you could imagine the giant swoll Vaporeon looming over.

Finally after walking along the trail for a few minutes you arrived at the wide and bright beach. You smiled as a breeze blasted you and the waves crashed on the shore. However your attention was drawn to another site. On the sand from the east side were large prints in the sand, the markings seem to be like that of a sandal sole. Finally they lead to a pair of building sized black sandals, alongside them was a blimp size pair of white trousers.

"Huh, is an anthro here? This beach is almost always vacant.", you curiously said making your way over to the giant wardrobe. Anthros did go to human beaches at times, gladly posing for photographers and letting people lay on them like boats.

You heard a loud splashing soon coming from a distance. Looking out into the sea you saw a blue and yellow fin wave in the water before a large head popped out of the water. Surprise filled you as the giant swimming was Aqua the Vaporeon! The Pokemon sighed as he stretched his large muscular arms over his head, the eyes of the giant soon landed on you and a smile grew.

"Hey amazing day huh?", the deep and sexy voice boomed vibrating the waves. Soon Aqua stood up, water cascades down his large body with ocean droplets going between his firm pecs and splashing like buckets in the water. Additionally the Vaporeon was dressed in a dark blue speedo. The buff drenched body was nearly on full display safe for the round bulge and firm butt being wrapped up.

1151.content:
You laid in on your bed half asleep and awake. The bleak plastic like walls surrounded you as you laid silently thinking over everything. Strange thoughts of contemplation hit you as you recounted your position right now.

Thud Thud

A light yet audible tapping came from the front of your house, far larger then a simple knock. A booming deep voice resounded from outside seeming to cover the whole building. "Hey buddy you up yet?", despite the deep tone and strength, the asker had a gentle kindness to the voice.

Pulling your covers off you decided to not spend all say in bed and actually accomplish something today. Making your way downstairs the room temperature increased as you made your way to the front, feeling the heat of the occupant outside.

Reaching the door you took a breath and opened the door to be faced with a looming, manly shadow.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
It was a cold night, you huddled closely to a giant vent in an effort to recieve warmth. The ground shook as one of the giant pokemon walked outside the alley you were in. This was the third day in this giant city of anthro pokemon, you were too scared to approach one and ask for directions to the nearest human city.

The last week had been a blur as you found yourself without much memory. You had a basic understanding of the world and your name but that was it. There were many different cities for humans and Pokemon, the one you woke up in was filled with 200ft tall anthro pokemon. Many worries came to mind, what if humans aren't allowed in the city? How would one react to seein you?

Sighing you leaned your head back and closed your eyes, feeling a sense of hopelessness. The ground began to shake again but you ignored it as it would cease like the rest. However the shaking grew more and you could hear the steps coming closer.

"A human...are you alright?", a deep surpised voice grew concerned as it boomed above.

Opening your eyes, you looked up in awe at the figure looming into the sky. From a pair of large orange paws you saw a pair of toned legs clothed in skinny jeans. Above that was a muscular torso clothed in a black jacket, the zipper down enough to show large buff creme scaled pecs.

The orange dragon like pokemon had concern in his blue eyes as he squatted down making his large muscled thighs clench. You blushed as the Charizard's handsome face looked over his huge pecs at you.

You suddenly scooted back in panic as the giant started reaching for you. A nearby trashcan prevented you from escape and you widened your eyes in fear. The Charizard softened his snout as he withdrew his large hand and instead set his large orange palm down before you.

"I'm sorry i didn't mean to scare you, but i promise i don't want to hurt you.", the giant softy spoke as he lightly waved his flamed tail.

You felt a strange.....comfort come from the giant's voice. Slowly you stood up and walked to the large hand, taking note how it had five appendages and had the clawed tips. Climbing on the warmth of the soft scaley skin immediately combated the cold you been staying in.

The Charizard slowly stood up bringing you past his jacket hugging his large muscles. The giant smiled as he looked directly onto your small form.

"I know you may be scared but i promise I'll help you. My name is Huǒyàn can you tell me yours?", Huǒyàn asked kindly as he protectively curled his fingers a little.

"I-I'm Claude.", you shyly said as the muscular Charizard held you in his large palm.

Huõyàn ended up being your sort of guardian on that night. There weren't any other humans in the city so the clues of your lost memory layed elsewhere. Untill then you were offered a place at Huõyàn's apartment, he even brought you a dollhouse to live in.

These acts of kindness put a certain warmness in your heart. Like a budding of love you feel towards someone you care about, but you were afraid to act on these feelings. How could a strong Charizard such Huõyàn love a tiny human like you?

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Unlike a normal Charizard, Huõyàn's stomach had a firm six pack of firm abs to accompany his large creme pecs. He had his biceped arms flexing as he placed his hands on his hips.

Huõyàn had an amused look as he spotted you before his hulking body. "So your not planning on sleeping all day?", your buff guardian boomed down.

You blushed at the joking tone as you rubbed your head. "Yeah..just stayed up a bit late last night.", you heard Huõyàn chuckle before setting his warm palm before you. You were soon held before the large pecs firm and bouncing with the Charizard's chuckles.

11512.content:
"I was thinking of heading out to the gym and work out today. I think it might do you some good to get some exercise in as well. But first..." Huõyàn sat you down near the edge of the nightstand next to his bed, where you discovered a veritable feast of breakfast that the monumental Charizard went through the trouble of making. "Most important meal of the day~" It was very small in a normal situation; half of a half of an apple slice, a little sliver of egg white, a strip of bacon as big as your leg, topped off with orange juice placed delicately in a thimble. You didn’t care that it was the crumbs of his own earlier meal, you still felt humbled he went through the trouble of putting it all together for you.

“Thanks, Huõyàn, sorry I left it sitting in the cold…” You rub the back of your neck in a bout of embarrassment, realizing that breakfast time was probably hours ago, and turn to face your Pokemon guardian, finding him in the middle of changing into his work-out clothes. “Gah...s-sorry, I didn’t know.” You promptly turn away to give Huõyàn his privacy while warn blood rushed to your face, but the Charizard merely bobbed his head to the side in confusion.

“Hmm? Claude, we’ve been over this.” Huõyàn frowned and walked over to the nightstand, his enormous bulge now in the open and brushing up against the edge where you stood. The air around you immediately grew warm and heavy with his natural scent, making your blush only intensify, something your guardian did not fail to notice. “You don’t have to be afraid of me, whether I’m in clothes or not. This is my natural state, I’m not embarrassed if you want to stare.”

“I’m sorry, Huõyàn, I didn’t mean any disrespect…” You force yourself to turn your head and face the Charizard you were talking to, but the moment you did your eyes wandered to his member. It was more than twice your height in length and almost as wide in girth, even in its flaccid state. It emanated a potent musk that sent your senses in a whirl, it was just so overwhelming and invading. From what you could glimpse of his balls, they were easily large enough to smother ten of you at the least. “It’s just very surreal, and it hammers in just how small I am...with how big it is.”

Huõyàn couldn't help but smile a little at that last remark, his already massive member twitching to life and grow before your eyes ever so slightly. You forced your jaw not to go limp and fall like some fool. “You flatter me, Claude, it’s nothing so special...though yes, to you it does seem rather sizeable.” You could see just the tiniest bit of ego rise up in his eyes as he tried to brush off your unintentional compliment, but it was then drowned out with worry as the main situation got back to him. “But I want you to be comfortable with me, Claude. Even if I was five times bigger I wouldn’t let anything happen to you, let anything scare you.” You suddenly were confronted with a mental image of Huõyàn a thousand feet tall, his genitalia big enough for you to be an insignificant speck on before you shook it out of your head.

You gave your Charizard guardian a reassuring smile before turning to tend to your breakfast. Satisfied with your condition, for now, Huõyàn went back to his changing, quickly putting on a white tank top that hugged his torso like a glove and a faded pair of sweatpants that had shrunk in the wash. You blushed as you bit into your apple slice, watching with a little less hesitation the Dragon Pokemon's tail swish against his globular, padded rear. It wasn't even ten o'clock, but he had managed to work up a thin film of sweat, the soft watery substance making his half-exposed backside glisten in the light from the window. He sat on his bed and pulled out his phone, waiting patiently for you to finish your breakfast. His bulge was even more pronounced now from when he was in his boxers, the snug wool hugging his shapely junk with no room for imagination. Soon, finally finished your meal, and Huõyàn deposited you in his back pocket for safekeeping.

You shimmied down to the bottom of the pocket lining as Huõyàn began his jog to the gym. 115331.content:
Deep within the mountain chains of the region lays an urban legend. It's said that experiments where conducted in a laboratory using the cells of the legendary Pokemon Mew. The results of the experiment were successful...for a time, the lifeform known as Mewtwo was stated to have anger that was ginormous. The fabled area where the experiments were conducted is bare with the faintest trace of buildings and what looks to be large foot shaped craters.

You were one of the madlads who decided to see if this urban legend was true. Well you were a nomad of sorts, traveling around and enjoying the new regions and pokemon. The unknown was just something that intrigued you, you why not your next endeavor be finding out if the tale of the giant Mewtwo is real?

Walking up the large mountains was pleasant as is, feeling the cold air send a strange noise around the large structures. The feeling of isolation was strong though. Other climbers didn't go as deep into the mountains as you were and the last Zubat you encountered was around an hour ago. Being alone was a chilling experience and fueled your desire to meet someone.

You thought about that feeling, being alone. Mewtwo was a creation with no others like it. Living out in these mountains in solitude with no other companionship can't be nice. As strange as it sounded, you thought if you could find Mewtwo maybe you could befriend the Pokemon.

As you staked your axe into the mountain you gasped as the rock you stepped on crumpled away! You looked down in terror as you only had your pickaxe keeping you from the vast canyon bottem below. The axe began to slowly slip out from the mountain, you felt dread fill you as soon the axe dislodged and you felt yourself falling.

"S-someone help!", you desperately screamed out as you fell to your doom.

Suddenly your free falling was paused and replaced with a weightless feeling. A strange blue light surrounded you as you floating in the air. Relief and shock filled you as your doomful descend was halted. Your questioning thoughts were pulled as a shaking series of booms resounded throughout the canyon.

From around the mountain at the end of the canyon a large figure emerged. You widened your eyes at the giant white and purple Pokemon shaking the ground beneath his feet. His body was ripped like that of a athlete with his large pecs and eight pack abs, his thighs were thick along with his buff arms. You blushed as you saw the only clothing on the giant was a tight black speedo wrapped around his round bulge. This giant...must be Mewtwo!

"A human? No one has every traveled out this far.", a deep voice spoke within your head as Mewtwo walked closer. The buff Pokemon crossed his large arms over his firm chest as you were brought up to his purple eyes.

You looked into the large eyes, you saw Mewtwo...

You happily trodded down the sidewalk, humming as you enjoyed the sunny day. You gave a greeting to everyone you passed both human and giant Pokemon anthro, getting a friendly reply in return. Living in a city of gigantic pokemon who could easily stomp normal sized structures flat was definitely a scary thought but in the Johto region more living areas have been constructed for the coexistence of both species. It was a little strange getting use to the casual appearance of these giants but you settled in well to your new home.

People always called you hyper and a optimist for your happy demeanor and urge to never give up. You pulled yourself together after moving to the city and now could live your life here no problem. Looking into different hobbies also helped you stay upbeat, since arriving here you began to get into working out and watching other's methods of muscle work.

You nodded still smiling, after a pat on the back, the manager walked off and your smile dropped. The gym you enjoyed visiting was closed and for who knows how long? 125331.content:
You trodden down the human walkway on the bridge crossing over a river. Bracing yourself against the strong winter wind that blew down its banks. Other humans waddled past, bundled up In jackets and scarves. A few made small greetings or nods, but most were just trying to get home before the imminent storm that was brewing began. For humans in this part of the world, blizzards and rain were lethal to get caught up in, as infrastructure in this city was designed more for the titans that inhabited it. A shadow passed over and a relaxed Typhlosion walked by your spot on the bridge, he himself crossing the river, which was more of a creek for his 200 foot form, he was already walking away and fading from sight and you had hardly made it halfway across the bridge. Most of the beings here averaged about 200 feet, fluctuating between 150-250 on average with some exceptions being taller, like legendaries....

         You were coming up on a hole in the human part of the bridge caused by a fight between anthros the other day when suddenly a cry from behind you yelled out.

         “Yo it’s freakin’ Lugia!” People flocked to the railing even though it wasn’t necessary to observe the Titan. His smooth white hide glistened even the overcast day, with the blue keratinous brow ridges accentuating his sleek design. He wore a grey jacket with an undershirt and dark grey sweatpants. He looked ahead, unperturbed by the flicks of humans Cat calling and trying to be acknowledged by the great legendary guardian of the seas. His biceps bulged under the tight jacket material and he huffed a steamy breath from his nostrils, ignoring the comments from people wanting to do all kind of things with him. You just stared in awe behind the crowd, and as you did his eyes drifted lazily down from its forward gaze as he continued to pass by. The ocean blue eyes locked onto you and your entire body filled with warmth, you never got much attention from any anthro, yet here was an essential god of this world acknowledging you. The corners of his beaked draconian face curved into some semblance of a smile. And people began their roar of cries again.

“He looked at me!”

“ No me!”

         The crowd began pushing and shoving, trying to prove they are in fact the one who earned a second of the Guardians attention. The brawl made its way to you when someone shoved a man a bit larger than you into you and sent you tumbling backwards... right where that hole in the bridge was...

         A gasp is all you let out as you plummet to the river some 500 feet below. The impact alone was going to kill you. You close your eyes and count yourself lucky though, your insignificant self had been noted by one of the most powerful creatures on this planet. Something warm wrapped around you and you opened your eyes to be in a room of white, with ridges and grooves galor. Wind still whistled out side and tiny holes told you that you were still falling. A horrible crash of water filled your ears and water seeped in between what you only could guess to be fingers. The water flowed over you and a current formed within the hands, you quickly lost consciousness...

....

         Your senses came back slowly, first your body letting you know that you were sore everywhere. You groaned and sat up, finding yourself wrapped in some fine furred blanket. A roaring fire sat in an enormous fireplace nearby, warming the monolithic room you were in. It was decorated with statues and books lining shelves. A shadow passed by you and you almost passed back out as Lugia rounded a sister chair to the one you were in the seat of. He threw what looked like his original attire over a cloth rack and turned it to the fire, leaving him standing in just red boxer briefs. His body was everything that legends were made of. His chest down into his boxed briefs was blue, while the rest of him was almost reflective white, it glowing orangish yellow in the firelight. His chest swelled with powerful pectorals and his belly was riveted with a six pack that contorted and looked good from any angle. His arms bulged as he hung the clothes, and his thighs flexed and twitched, wanting to unleash their strength again like they did probably with him hopping off the bridge. His tail lashed lazily around, coming out of his lower back above a very round butt, one cheek easily the size of your own home.

         His eye drifted to you and gave you that feeling again when you were on the bridge.

         “You’re awake, good, and how do we feel.” His voice was calm and musical, and under it lay eons of wisdom.

         “Um fine I think, thank you, the fact that you took time out of your busy schedule to save someone like me-“ before you could finished he got an annoyed expression and closed his eyes.”

         ”Please, please, don’t be like that. I saved you because it’s what I do, not because I expect praise or worship. I’m just a normal guy living through life.” He said slumping into the other chair.

         ”But shouldn’t I worship? You’re a god essentially, and living through life? Haven’t you been around since like the beginning.” You ask, curiosity at an all time high. He rolled his shoulders and bounced a leg slowly.

         ”Yes and Yes, but when you’ve spent millennia being seen as an idol rather than a person, don’t you think it gets a little dull?” He said giving you a sorrowful smile. “If you wanna grab a legendary Pokémon’s attention, treat them casually and watch how they flock to you. Most of us go day to day, set in our duty given by Arceus, living the same thing over and over, saving you was a small step out of the norm, and I seized it.” He said slouching in the chair , you were listening but also still admiring his muscles.

         “So, you want me to chat with you like you’re just some guy I’m sitting with at the bar cutting up.” You ask.

         “It wouldn’t hurt, one thing about deification and immortality, human, is that it is awfully lonely.” He says huffing.

         Well...my name is Jamie.” You say extending out a hand. A smile creeps back across Lugia’s face as he extends a hand with one finger outstretched.

         “I’m Lugia...”
125331.title: Lugia

15231.content:
Long ago in the Kalos region there was a big and terrible war. Human against human, anthro against human, it was a war that brought nothing but destruction and pain. After a human king lost his beloved Pokemon he used a powerful machine to try and bring them back. He succeeded, but only after sacrificing many Pokemon to fuel this destructive device.


The war had ended but conflict didn't seem to cease. Humans and giant anthro Pokemon were separated from each other after coexisting seem to only more fighting. Humans saw the anthros as destructive beasts and the anthros saw the humans as selfish little creatures.


In the present peace seem to come, only after humans were forced out of the cities just in a petty attempt to quelch the tensions. In a forest was a anthro separated from this ethical drama. A Pangoro named Tanjiro spent his days as a bamboo cutter, selling the stocks to small businesses and even teaching wandering youths some skill in the fighting arts.


Tanjiro's family had held not favorable views of humans, they saw them as creatures that should stay below them like insects. The Pangoro refused to accept these beliefs and he went into self exile, wanting to carve out his own path.


He could have been a noble swordsman in his family's clan, but he'd sooner bite his tongue then treat a human as lesser than him. It had been 20 years now he was in his thirties, despite a few lines on his face Tanjiro was still attractive. He had very buff biceps from his daily training and hauling stacks of bamboo. He wore a loose white kimeno top that let his huge white furred pecs mostly hang out, dark blue hakama pants that wrapped around his thick thighs and toned calves. Unlike a normal Pangoro his stomach was that of a six pack, ripped with muscle from his numerous sit ups.


While it was a peaceful life, Tanjiro couldn't help but desire company. While he enjoyed teaching his skills to others, they were merely his students. Having a close bond to share with someone in love would be all he could ask for.

______________________________


You sighed as you walked into the forest, the trees towering higher then a skyscraper. It was hitting you just how rash this decision might have been.


Your name was Kou, a 25 year old human from a small village. Before you were born, your parents moved to the village after the anthros expelled them and the human populace from their city. Your family while loving, struggled to maintain their farming and food. Wanting them to be happy and healthy you decided to leave to not have them stuggle preparing your food with the minimal money.


This of course meant you living on the road as you had no set path in mind. It went from a trip on the road to a dangerous journey, you had crossed into anthro Pokemon territory and now needed to find a way out. If you were found trespassing you very well could be arrested.


Still, being in the countryside was slightly reassuring, the anthros here are notably more calm and wishing for coexistence with humans. But it was still a dangerous territory so you trekked on, soon entering a large bamboo forest


Walking through the atmosphere was definitely peaceful, the air was clear and carried the wind ruffling the leaves. It helped calm you a little taking in the tranquil environment you never appreciated. You knew these woods weren't empty however, there had been signs for a bamboo shop up and occasionally spare carts next to gatherings of plants. While it was risky you should find this bamboo seller, even if he was an anthro you needed directions or something. You just hoped he didn't hate humans....


After walking down the path directed by the signs, you soon found a cozy looking Minka sitting in the clearing made. You looked in awe as you walked up, having never seen such a house of this design. Stopping in front of the large sliding door, you began to wonder how you would be able knock loud enough.


Suddenly the ground thumped as it did whenever a giant pokemon walked and the door slid open, a shadow casting over. Looking up, you found yourself in awe as past a pair of loose pants was a towering figure. His creme furred abs led up to the large pecs that partially covered the face of an anthro Pangoro. The Pokemon sighed as the fresh air hit his large muscular body, making it instinctively flex.

You soon….

It seems like everything is still a huge surprise, and it just happened last week. Well you guess it all started when you moved to Alola ten years ago. It certainly was exciting to live in a new area, filled with not only new Pokemon but anthro ones as well! All working alongside humans and living in harmony.

You started on your journey here by befriending a Litten named Ahi. He was a bit of a hothead and originally against teaming up with you, wanting to complete the island trials on his own. But over the course of your journey the two of you grew closer and developed a strong bond of friendship. Now with the both of you at 20 years old Ahi was a Incineroar and definitely trained his body in terms of muscle.

After your journey you and Ahi enjoyed a calm yet exciting life together. Most days you'd relax in the beach while the fire cat worked out. You blushed as you remember his huge pecs and biceps flexing and his ripped body covered only by the speedos he'd enjoyed wearing.

However last year a strange phenomenon began happening with the anthro Pokemon of Alola. The Z crystals given to anthro partners began to react differently then normal, the result was Pokemon growing to a huge height of 200 ft. While the phenomenon shocked the residents of the Alola region, the Aether foundation quickly gave assistance.

A new artificial island was constructed, a place where the giants could comfortably live without fear of accidentally smashing any buildings. Of course the island was opened for the humans to visit their partners anytime. The island was luckily completely by the time Ahi ended up going through his growth phase. "Yuki sweetie your visiting Ahi today right? You should start heading down to the marina!", your mom called from inside.

"Ok I'll be out in a minute!", you called out checking your phone. Ahi had messaged you asking to hang out, which you eagerly agreed on.

The giants were given many things they would have at normal size such as clothes, phones, etc. It truly normalized this phenomenon, though it was a bit sad you couldn't spend the days like you used to. You and Ahi sleeping in one bed, him wrapping his buff arms around you while you rested your head on his grey pecs.

You shook off a blush as you went inside from the side patio. Saying goodbye to your mom and Meowth, you started jogging to Hau'oli City to reach the marina.

15433332.content:
Love can often be strange, it can be sweet but also complicated. It often brings people together both for feelings of comradery and affection. For you, love brought you and your boyfriend together despite the obvious differences. You were a scholarly type of person who wanted to become a teacher after college, your boyfriend was the lead guitarist in a band and paved a career of playing rock music. Your body was thin and lean while your boyfriend was nothing short of muscle.

The biggest difference however was that you were a human and your boyfriend was a giant anthro Toxtricity.

A few years ago the dynamax phenomenon began to take a strange turn. Anthro pokemon began to increase in size up to 200 ft tall, still innovation came quick and new accommodations were made for the permanent giants. It all became another part of Galar's culture, seeing giant anthros walking around was now a norm.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
You smiled as you button up your shirt, looking quite presentable in the white shirt and brown trousers. Today was special as you had a train scheduled for Wyndon to see your boyfriend Alfie. After a summer of working you finally were now finished and could focus on school and life. Immediately you felt longing to be with Alfie after only calls for the past two months, both of you were preoccupied with work and finally had the chance to spend time.

After gathering the last of your supplies you set off to the train station. As you sat in the train car and made your way to Wyndon, you made to sure to admire the scenery and giants casually stomping alongside the train. Some even smiled and waved as the train past. Soon you arrived in Wyndon and happily trodded to the home of Alfie deep in the now even bigger city.

As you walked down the street, waving to cyclist and giant alike excitement began to fill your stomach as you remembered your last moment with your Toxtricity boyfriend. He gave you a tender kiss and said he would always wait for you, Arceus you were blessed.

Soon walking up to a familiar apartment with an open garage, you began to hear rock music softly blasting from inside. Standing at the looming garage entrance you soon saw the familiar giant figure of your boyfriend. Alfie was facing away as he polished his guitar, this gave of a full display of his large backside.

Up from his yellow soled feet, Alfie's toned legs and firm thighs were hugged by a pair of grey jeans. The large firm butt with yellow slightly peaking out of the crack was briefly shown as the top stuck out of his pants. Alfie's back was toned and broadened by his shoulders, the scaly purple arms flexed their huge biceps unintentionally as he moved them to clean the guitar.

"Um hey Alfie!", you called out hoping he would hear you. Luckily he appeared to as his head perked up and he turned around, showing his yellow underbelly which included his huge pecs and six packs being squeezed by his black tank top.

Alfie's eyes lit up and he grinned as he spotted you. "Arthur! It's been too long baby!", walking over Alfie shook the ground beneath his large feet as he soon towered his buff body into the sky before you.

Reaching down, Alfie gently scooped you ip into his warm palm. You of course had no problem, you held trust with Alfie and knew he'd never hurt you. Bringing you up to his pecs, Alfie then walked over to a couch he had set up in his music studio (aka the garage). Laying down, the Toxtricity set you on his warm right pec before putting his buff arms behind his head. Alfie smiled at you as he longed back.

"So babe you doing good, getting closer to the dream of yours?", you smiled and laid down on the firm and warm clothed pec. "I guess, all that's left is to take my final courses and I'll get my degree."

Alfie grinned toothily as he reached down and rubbed your head using one of his five fingers. "Ah great work, you'll be a teach in no time!"

You blushed as you thanked the buff lizard Pokemon.

Soon....

info.brief_description: You live in a world where giant anthro Pokeon and normal Pokemon coexist with humans.
info.description:
This interactive is a counter one to coolguy's Sexual Giant Female Pokemon. https://www.writing.com/main/interact/item_id/1389755-Sexual-Giant-Female-Pokemo... I asked and he siad this was okay to make this since his pfeamle only when it comes to main interactions. So with that said you are a human (insert name here) who lives in a world with giant anthro and normal Pokemon. And since the giant male anthro Pokemon are heavily muscled hunks, who know you might be able to get one of them to be interested in you and not only start a relationship, but something more. Anyway here are the rules.

1. This story only has M/M interactions. So any Pokemon that are more so viewed as females (this goes for some of the legendary Pokemon as well) should not be interacted with at all. But of course this does not mean that the female anthro Pokemon aren't there. They just aren't the main focus and should only be mentioned if need be. The same is applied for both genders of normal Pokemon as well. Also only final forms are allowed in this story. (Pikachu is excluded from that rule because well he is the mascot of Pokemon after all) And also not all Pokemon will be anthros since certain ones just wouldn't make any sense as anthros if I'm being honest. (like steel types, and other certain Pokemon)

2. You can find an odd berry that can cause the male anthro Pokemon to grow even bigger then he might already be. (optional)

3. No gore, death, or toilet stuff at all.

4. If you have a giant anthro Pokemon grow the max size is 10,000 feet. Unless it's one of the Legendary Pokemon since they are more powerful then the other ones they can grow up to 20,000 feet. (again optional)

5. Please use proper grammar and spacing.

6. Have fun.
